title.native: ペンギン・ハイウェイ

description:
Budding genius Aoyama is only in the 4th grade, but already lives his life like a scientist. When penguins start appearing in his sleepy suburb hundreds of miles from the sea, Aoyama vows to solve the mystery. When he finds the source of the penguins is a woman from his dentist’s office, they team up for an unforgettable summer adventure!

(Source: Eleven Arts)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tomihiko_Morimi) | [Blog](https://tomio.hatenablog.com/)
 
A Japanese writer from Nara Prefecture. He graduated from Kyoto University and his works often have Kyoto as the setting.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tete_hiroyasu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/ishidahiroyasutete) 

Former student of Kyoto Seika University, currently employed at Studio Colorido.

He gained notoriety on the internet during his university years thanks to the short "Fumiko no Kokuhaku," a two-minute-long animation released in 2009 (when he was only 21) and produced entirely by himself. The short attracted attention internationally and won him the Japanese YouTube Video Award. He graduated in 2011 with the project "Rain Town."

He has won several awards as a young and emergent artist, his work has been featured in the Newtype magazine and praised by the likes of [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uedamakoto_ek)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pochi1989) | [Tumblr](https://pochi1989.tumblr.com/)

Initially from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Currently employed at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).

Also an illustrator of novels and children's books.

[Website](https://www.utadahikaru.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChcgcbX3zMBwd0wTJyy2JlA) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/utadahikaru) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kuma_power/)

Hikaru Utada is a Japanese-American singer-songwriter, composer and producer.

Born in the United States to Japanese parents, record producer Utada Teruzane and enka singer Keiko Fuji, Utada began to write music and lyrics at an early age and often traveled to Tokyo as a result of their father's job. Eventually, a recording contract with Toshiba-EMI was signed and, under the stage name Cubic U, Utada released their English-language debut album Precious in early 1998, but it was a commercial failure. In the following year, heavily influenced by R&B and dance-pop, their Japanese-language debut First Love was released and became an instant success. Backed by the massive success of singles "Automatic," "Time Will Tell," and "Movin' On Without You," the album sold two million copies in its first week in Japan, topped the Oricon charts for six non-consecutive weeks and went on to sell six million more throughout the rest of 1999. First Love eventually became the country's best-selling album of all time.

By the end of the '00s, Utada was deemed "the most influential artist of the decade" in the Japanese music landscape by The Japan Times. Utada's commercial success has made them one of Japan's top-selling recording artists of all time with over 37 million records sold since launching their career in the late '90s. Twelve of their singles have reached number-one on the Oricon Singles Chart, while ten of their albums have become chart-toppers. Six of their full-length releases are among the country's highest-selling albums of all time, including First Love, Distance and Deep River, which are among the top ten best-selling records of Japan's music history.

Utada has performed theme songs for all of the four [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/2759/) reboot movies, as well as for [Freedom](https://anilist.co/anime/1747/) and [To Your Eternity](https://anilist.co/anime/114535/).

Additionally, they are also known by international audiences for writing and producing four theme-songs to the video game series Kingdom Hearts.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/katsu_nak)

Affiliated with Sound Box.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namiko_ishidate) | [Website](https://www.namikoishidate.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunoyoko) | [Website](http://kunoyoko.tumblr.com)

A graduate of the Department of Graphic Design at Tama Art University. While still a student, she created installations, sculptures, and animated works centering on themes of young girls, animals, delinquents and other motifs with an undefinable graphic quality.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namiko_ishidate) | [Website](https://www.namikoishidate.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/63027303)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namiko_ishidate) | [Website](https://www.namikoishidate.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogurasi2) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/misuyaraguo/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/木村絵理子)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/namiko_ishidate) | [Website](https://www.namikoishidate.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pochi1989) | [Tumblr](https://pochi1989.tumblr.com/)

Also an illustrator of novels and children's books.

Initially from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/). Currently employed at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).

Also an illustrator of novels and children's books.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tete_hiroyasu) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/ishidahiroyasutete) 

Former student of Kyoto Seika University, currently employed at Studio Colorido.

He gained notoriety on the internet during his university years thanks to the short "Fumiko no Kokuhaku," a two-minute-long animation released in 2009 (when he was only 21) and produced entirely by himself. The short attracted attention internationally and won him the Japanese YouTube Video Award. He graduated in 2011 with the project "Rain Town."

He has won several awards as a young and emergent artist, his work has been featured in the Newtype magazine and praised by the likes of [Mamoru Hosoda](https://anilist.co/staff/100067/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomotaka_shiba)

At the start of his career he worked at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/) as a digital painter and only switched to animating after leaving the company. He has taken part in numerous of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' productions since the release of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/). Currently he working as a director at [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chau_kotori)

Graduated from Kyoto Seika University in 2012. Japanese animator, director and storyboard artist. Leader and founder of Studio Colorido's Team Yamahitsuji since fall 2018.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/CAT0004)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/billion92863478)

Originating from [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and joined [Studio Colorido](https://anilist.co/studio/4419/Studio-Colorido) in 2012.
